info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.tenant
info.description: Package for working with Tenant representation.

get.description: Checks if a cname is available.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

get.description: GetPasswordPolicy returns password policy for tenant.

post.description:
Assign domain owner tries to assign domain owner to user in the request. It checks that requester is domain owner as well.
It implies such steps:
1) mark user as domain owner
2) if user is SSO
 - mark user as volterra managed
 - send update password email
3) set admin roles in system, shared, * namespaces
NOTE: previous roles (which was explicitly assigned to this user) will be deleted

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

post.description:
Unassign domain owner tries to remove domain owner privilege from user in the request.
It checks that requester is domain owner.
It implies such steps:
1) remove domain owner boolean flag
2) if tenant has SSO enabled:
 - mark user as SSO
 - delete password credential
 - delete OTP credential (if exists)
NOTE: previously granted roles (including admin roles) will be retained

content_type.description: The HTTP Content-Type header value specifying the content type of the body.

data.description: The HTTP request/response body as raw binary.

extensions.description:
Application specific response metadata. Must be set in the first response
for streaming APIs.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

schematenantEmpty.description: This can be used for messages where no values are needed
schematenantEmpty.title: Empty

schematenantFSMState.description:
Tenant states https://gitlab.com/volterra/ves.io/eywa/-/wikis/Tenant-State-Machine.

 - StateUndefined: StateUndefined

Tenant state when it was created without any state.
 - StateCreating: StateCreating

Tenant state of initial bootstrapping tenant, registering tenant in other service and
pre-create default objects for the tenant like default namespaces, default roles etc.
 - StateCreateFailed: StateCreateFailed

Tenant state when initial bootstrapping was failed by some reason and must be retried
after issue is solved.
 - StateInactive: StateInactive

Tenant state when initial creation is completed and we have trigger next stage of tenant
registration like creating support account, billing account in third party services.
 - StateActive: StateActive

Tenant state of completely registered tenant and available to use.
 - StateSuspended: StateSuspended

Tenant state of suspended tenant by some reason like not finished billing payments,
manually suspended by administrator, etc.
 - StateDisabled: StateDisabled

Tenant state of disabled tenant which are in pre-deletion state.
 - StateConfiguring: StateConfiguring

Configuring state of the specific tenant, can be set for instance if tenant is setting up billing account, etc..
 - StateConfiguringFailed: StateConfiguringFailed

Configuring state of the specific tenant, can be set for instance if tenant is setting up billing account, etc..
schematenantFSMState.title: States

email.description:
assign domain owner to user with this email

Example: ` "joe.doe@acme.com"`
email.title: Email

tenantCredentialsExpiry.description: CredentialsExpiry is a struct that holds max expiration days setting for the different credentials.
tenantCredentialsExpiry.title: CredentialsExpiry

max_api_certificate_expiry_days.description:
Certificate expiry period as days

Example: ` "90"`
max_api_certificate_expiry_days.title: Certificate expiry period

max_api_token_expiry_days.description:
Token expiry period as days

Example: ` "90"`
max_api_token_expiry_days.title: Token expiry period

max_kube_config_expiry_days.description:
TokeKubeconfign expiry period as days

Example: ` "90"`
max_kube_config_expiry_days.title: Kubeconfig expiry period

feedback.description:
Feedback from the customer related to reason of account deactivation.

Example: ` "Customers feedback"`
feedback.title: Feedback

job_id.description: Job id of the async job that triggered to process the tenant deactivation.
job_id.title: Job Id

tenantDeleteTenantRequest.description: Request for marking Tenant for deletion.
tenantDeleteTenantRequest.title: DeleteTenantRequest

email.description:
Email of freemium account which need to be deleted.

Example: ` "test@test.com"`
email.title: Email

feedback.description:
Feedback from the customer related to reason of account deletion.

Example: ` "Customers feedback"`
feedback.title: Feedback

name.description:
Tenant name marked for deletion.

Example: ` "tenant-1"`
name.title: Name

tenantDeletionReason.description:
List of available reason for account deletion.

 - REASON_UNKNOWN: Unknown reason

Unknown reason
 - REASON_SWITCH_TO_FREE_PLAN: Switch to free plan

Switch to free plan
 - REASON_NO_LONGER_NEEDED: No longer needed

No longer needed
 - REASON_NOT_JUSTIFY_COSTS: Too expensive

Too expensive
 - REASON_DIFFICULT_TO_USE: Difficult to use

Difficult to use
tenantDeletionReason.title: DeletionReason

tenantGetLoginEventsInTimeFrameRequest.description: Contains fields to retrieve events in timeframe
tenantGetLoginEventsInTimeFrameRequest.title: GetLoginEventsInTimeFrameRequest

tenantLoginEvent.description:
x-displayName: "LoginEvent"
Contains information about specific login event, like when exactly it happened, from which IP address, etc...
tenantLoginEvent.title: LoginEvent

ip_address.description:
x-displayName: "IP address"
x-example: "127.0.0.1"
IP address the login accessed from
ip_address.title: IP address

username.description:
x-displayName: "Username"
x-example: "joe.doe"
Username of the login
username.title: Username

tenantLoginEvents.description:
x-displayName: "LoginEvents"
Contains list of login events.
tenantLoginEvents.title: LoginEvents

login_events.description:
x-displayName: "Login events"
Collection of login events based on input filter
login_events.title: Login events

tenantLoginEventsMap.description: LoginEventsMap is a map from username to list of login events. In can be useful have login events grouped by usernames.
tenantLoginEventsMap.title: LoginEventsMap

login_events_map.description: Map of login events based on input filter group by username
login_events_map.title: Login map

tenantOtpStatus.description:
OtpStatus can be either enabled/disabled or processing.
Applying new policy can take time, especially if tenant has many users so for this purpose processing state is introduced.

 - OTP_DISABLED: OTP_DISABLED

OTP disabled
 - OTP_ENABLED: OTP_ENABLED

OTP enabled
 - OTP_PROCESSING: OTP_PROCESSING

OTP is being updated
 - OTP_PROCESS_DISABLING: OTP_PROCESSING

OTP is being updated to be disabled
tenantOtpStatus.title: OtpStatus

tenantPasswordPolicyPublicAccess.description:
PasswordPolicyPublicAccess contains subset of password policy settings. This settings will be available publicly
without authentication.
tenantPasswordPolicyPublicAccess.title: PasswordPolicyPublicAccess

not_recently_used.description:
Number of previous passwords to check for equality - if match found the password is rejected

Example: ` "1"`
not_recently_used.title: not_recently_used

not_username.description: If true then username must not appear in the password string
not_username.title: not_username

tenantStatusResponse.description:
LookupCnameResponse sets the response format based on the availability of cname.

It can return any of these three types of errors.
EEXISTS => cname exists.
EOK => valid request. However, cname does not exist.
EUNKNOWN => internal error in fetching tenants info.

tenantSupportInfo.description: Support Info contains support information for tenant
tenantSupportInfo.title: Support Info

active_plan_transition_id.description:
Id of the plan transition request which is currently in state CREATING.

Example: ` "7e1ba0f9-26dc-4397-97b3-b600df2097d3"`

name will represent name of the tenant that is being accessed

Example: ` "tenant1"`

orginal_tenant represent tenant id where the user belongs to

sso_enabled.description: Flag to show SSO is enabled for specific tenant.

Example: ` "dXNlci1pbWFnZS5qcGVn"`

sso_enabled.description: Flag to show SSO is enabled for specific tenant.

validation_errors.description:
x-displayName : "Validation errors"
 collection of validation errors
validation_errors.title: validation errors

tenantUser.description: Login user representation. Currently users are identified by their email.
tenantUser.title: User

tenantValidationErrorField.description: Contains information on a single validation error
tenantValidationErrorField.title: Validation error field

error_field.description:
path indicates the field that is not valid

Example: ` "max_credentials_expiry"`
error_field.title: Error field

error_message.description:
more descriptive error message

Example: ` "max_credentials_expiry code should be less < 0 "`
error_message.title: Error message

display_name.description:
Tenant display name in the login screen

Example: ` "value"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.k8s_label_value: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 255
display_name.title: Display Name

max_login_failures.description:
How many failures before wait is triggered.
 When login failure count is hit, user will be temporarily locked for a max duration of 15 minutes.

Example: ` "5"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 30
max_login_failures.title: Max Login Failures

digits.description:
The number of digits required to be in the password string.

Example: ` "1"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 16
digits.title: Digits

expire_password.description:
The number of days for which the password is valid.
 After the number of days has expired, the user is required to change their password.

Example: ` "30"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 1080
expire_password.title: Expire Password

lowercase_characters.description:
The number of lower case letters required to be in the password string.

Example: ` "8"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 16
lowercase_characters.title: Lowercase Characters

minimum_length.description:
Minimum length of password.

Example: ` "12"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 7
minimum_length.title: Minimum Length

not_recently_used.description:
This policy is used to restrict user from using previously used passwords.
 Number that's set determines number of last passwords which user cannot use as new password.

Example: ` "2"`
not_recently_used.title: Not Recently Used

not_username.description: When set, the password is not allowed to be the same as the username.
not_username.title: Not Username

special_characters.description:
The number of special characters like '?!#%$' required to be in the password string.

Example: ` "1"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 16
special_characters.title: Special Characters

uppercase_characters.description:
The number of upper case letters required to be in the password string.

Example: ` "2"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 16
uppercase_characters.title: Uppercase Characters

cookie_expiry.description:
x-displayName: "Session Cookie Expiry"
x-required
x-example: "900"
Session cookie expiry in seconds.
The user will be logged-out after these many seconds, if inactive on the console.
cookie_expiry.title: Session Cookie Expiry

cookie_refresh_interval.description:
x-displayName: "Session Cookie Refresh Interval"
x-example: "840"
Session cookie refresh interval in seconds.
The session cookie will be renewed when (expiry - current_timestamp < cookie_refresh_interval) and (max_session_expiry - expiry > cookie_refresh_interval ), otherwise, the existing cookie will be re-used
cookie_refresh_interval.title: Session Cookie Refresh Interval

session_expiry.description:
x-displayName: "Maximum Session Expiry"
x-required
x-example: "86400"
Maximum session expiry in seconds.
The user will be prompted for a re-login after this interval in spite of being active on the console
session_expiry.title: Maximum Session Expiry

viewstenant_configurationGlobalSpecType.description: Shape of the tenant configuration specification
viewstenant_configurationGlobalSpecType.title: GlobalSpecType
